div1.head: Notes on James Carroll, by Albert E. Truby, [19--]
div1.p:
I think that Carroll's letter of
Aug 18 is a very honest statement
regarding his work. His statement
on page 3 regarding the withholding
of info. are some of the things may
also be true. If so young Carroll
may have that “written evidence” and possibly
he might let you have it, if
you told him that you would like to substantiate his
Father's statement,

Notice that Carroll states that
Lazear applied the insects to him
xy. Also note, p. 4. that
Reed “wrote the report”. He claims
nothing about assisting Reed in
this. I know he was not physically
fit and did not help write the report.
The report too was finished before
Agramonte returned from the U.S.
(Over)

Carroll made several
errors in dates etc as
you will note- He probably
had no good records to
help him when he wrote
the letter.

I think “The Outlook” article
and this correspondence in what
started the fireworks in Carroll's
case. When was Hammeter's article
written? That is important, and
indicates if I am right, that
Carroll & his friends started
out to inform the public of the great
importance of C's work on the Bd.
Agramonte got his case from
Carroll's success but kept
quiet until after Carroll was
dead- (Over)

I have just found in my
book that Hammeter's article was
published in 1908, same year
that Carroll died. Possibly-
that was instrumented in bringing
about the final Cardiac spasm
that caused his death over
